page.title: 17 MAY DAY
page.content: {MAY DAY CELEBRATIONS On May Bank Holiday Monday every year there is always a special event organ- ised by The School Association and held in Legbourne Village Hall.The May Queen who has been chosen from the fourth year girls of Legbourne School is crowned by the retiring Queen.In 1985 the retiring Queen was Lucy Sturman and the new Queen was Lisa Slingsby.The school children sang songs of "The Good Old Days". There are stalls like cake, plant and clothes stalls and there are plenty of games like a treasure hunt,guess how many sweets in a jar and a raffle for people to spend their money on. Tea and cakes are served.Proceeds are spent on buying extras for the school. The weather is usually too cold for Maypole Dancing so that is usually performed on the school's Open Day.
